long_desc.thetext:
NPM is often offline or slowly responding. Find a way to avoid the need to access NPM online with every new skeleton that is created.
This is less an issue for our users than for ourselves. Creating skeleton apps for testing or debugging purposes is a frequent task in the core team. If an invocation of 'create-application.py' takes minutes to complete because of 'npm install' running slowly in the background, this is a hinderance for us. This is especially unfortunate as for a given tool chain these modules are always the same.
Needless to say that this would also benefit users working offline with the SDK.
Possible solutions would be using shared node_modules (e.g. by linking the local node_modules/ folder to a shared folder, or copying the shared folder into the skeleton during create-application), or running NPM with something like a 'cache-only' mode where modules are always taken from the cache if present, without preceding online check.
